Fear is the strongest emotion the human species bends to, not lust. Become the scariest monster to get back what all the other monsters have taken from you. Become ruthless, merciless, have no qualms with doing the unpleasant to bad people. Though fear, show your mercy to the ones you wish to save. Because once the thing they fear is offering them compassionate mercy, they will be helpless, but to take it. And that’s how you save them. To shatter that lust-filled or fear-filled reality that they were thrown into. To open their eyes, once more. To actually happiness, not lust.

They walked down the blood covered stairs, and through the corpse filled lobby to a car waiting for them outside. Two men that looked like in guard clothing waited in the driver and passenger seat. The masked man helped her inside, as they both got in the back. Then the car floored it away. Soon the entire building exploded behind them into a bright red fire. “I swear I’ll never do something like this again… I swear… I swear… You’re the only one that ever really cared about me after all.” The masked man took his mask off and lowered his hoodie. He then lowered his head on her shoulder “I know, I know. You’re safe now, you don’t have to worry. You know I could never hurt you. I will bring back that smile of yours.”

Immediately a flurry of bullets flew from the doorway at the leader. Blood poured out from each hole that the bullets pierced, it was like a blood sprinkler for the window behind him. The man then collapsed to the ground, blood continued to pour out of his dead body. Consuming the white marble floor around him. “There’s one thing you should know, you shouldn’t have tried to shoot the girl you took from the man that still loved her. And it appears you didn’t love her as much as I did.” The girl was curled up, crying from processing what was about to happen. The mask man ran over to her and held her by the shoulders. Genuine, heartfelt eyes could be seen in his eyes. The girl sank into his chest; crying as she hugged him. The man helped her up; holding her head into his chest with one hand as he guided her out of the room. “I’m sorry… for everything… I-I.” “We can talk about that later sweety.”

“No moving until I leave this room, otherwise you won’t get a chance to live.” Then he quickly put the machine gun’s barrel to the back of the leader as he was freed too. Then the masked man got up and calmly walked away aiming his gun towards the two. “Life or die, make your choice.” He then disappeared into the hallway. Immediately the leader grabbed the gun and aimed it at the girl. His hand was shaking. “Wait… please… there must be another way… I don’t want this to go any further…” She felt broken. “I’m sorry, but you heard him, only one of us can live. And I’m sorry I don’t love you more than my own life… I’m sorry.” His finger itches at the trigger. She broke down crying “Please… I never wanted this… I never wanted things to be this way…” “I know.”

“I once thought it was my fault, I wasn’t good enough. So I made an atonement in my own way for her. If she doesn’t value me that I would take my own life for her, maybe she would value the scars that I can take… Even if I’m not what qualifies as the best to her… But I show I can take a beating for her.” The girl’s mouth was agape in surprise, and pain at what she was witnessing. “Enough of that now. It is time for the choice.” He lowered his shirt back down and placed the revolver with one bullet in it in the middle of the two. “You’ll have one minute to decide before I decide to kill both of you. I will free you from your bindings and once I leave the room, the one minute starts. If I don’t hear a shot go off and a body falling to the ground within that minute, then you already know what will happen.” The leader and the girl both looked at the gun in dread. The masked man first went over to the girl and freed her. But he then aimed his machine gun at her as he moved to the leader.

The masked man stopped and walked over to the girl with his knife. He had it slide across her face. She was scared because she didn’t know what he planned on doing. He continued to play with the knife in front of her. Until he got up and stood between the two. “I loved her so much, did you know that? So much I’d give myself for her to live, but I guess she doesn’t value that in a man. She doesn’t value decency. So now it’s time to prove your own mettle. You can still live, if you take the gun I give you and you shoot her dead, I’ll let you walk free. Or if you really care about her life more than yours you could allow her to shoot you, killing you, but saving her life…” The masked man then lifted his shirt up to reveal many cuts and scars surrounding his chest, stomach, and back.

A right hook to the face, a left hook to the stomach. A kick to the crotch. A knee to the face. So much rage was built inside of him. He couldn't help himself, but to release it. Then an announcement came over the transmission system. “Hello, hello. If there is anyone still alive and can make it to the entrance doors, the security team has managed to bypass the lockdown. So if you are able to, run for the exits. We have already helped free people that were trapped in some rooms so for everyone else still hiding and can safely run, go for the exit.” Then the transmission ended

He glanced at the girl and then brought the picture in the locket to his face. The man sighed, emotionlessness began to fill his eyes once more. He then turned the picture towards the girl. Her heart skipped a beat as her eyes widened in guilt. It was him, him in the picture, him in front of her. Pain, and guilt can be seen struck across her face. He had known. Words weren’t able to come out of her mouth as she tried to speak, she was only able to give tears, not words. But she could see the pain return to his eyes. He was crying too. Betrayal, pain, guilt, despair, rage. It was all mixing together, to one dangerous concoction. It felt like minutes passed as they stared into each other's emotion filled eyes. The masked man sharply exhaled out his nose as he suddenly turned and punched the leader in the face. Rage overflowed in him as he kept pummeling the man. His punch made him feel a little better so he kept going, again and again.

(After several more brutalities later. The man let all the girls that had a man dead in front of her free.)
Finally, it was the last leader. But this time he looked over to the girl across from the leader intently. She noticed this, but couldn’t understand why, yet. The man reached his hands underneath the hoodie and it appeared he took off a necklace from underneath the hoodie. It was a golden locket, the masked man opened it and looked inside. There was a photo of a smiling man and a happy girl, who was she? Sister, friend, girlfriend, wife? It doesn't matter. But the masked man’s hand was shaking. Pain filled his eyes as he held back tears. The woman felt some type of familiarity to the locket, like she knew it was, but is it him? The masked man let the locket swing side to side in the air by the chain as he walked up to the girl and crouched before her.

The only noise that still continued was the cries from everyone in the room. Next, the masked man took another red orb. He simply tossed it in front of the man, and as it smashed the ground the next leader caught on fire. The mask man just stared with no emotion in his eyes at the burning man. The man shook, and rolled on the ground wildly, but the fire wouldn’t go out. For a few minutes the man agonizingly struggled against the fire, until his body also joined the others laying dead on the ground, succumbing to the burns on his body. The next leader was choked to death, he couldn't even do anything. He could only wait until the lack of oxygen made him pass out, and then the masked man shot his head off.

He had the girls cuffed to the cemented table across from the leaders that he had duct taped and on their knees. They weren’t men, just the rot that needs to be destroyed. The masked man can’t even make out their faces, he just sees NTR covering their faces, and that’s enough for him. 
 
The first leader had one of the lighter sentences. The masked man simply brought his knife to the man’s neck and slit it. He fell to the ground bleeding out. It was at this moment they all realized there would be no negotiating to survive. The next leader would have himself kneecapped. The pain was excruciating as he cried from each shot. A muffled sentence came from the man’s crying mouth. It sounded like “I want my mommy.” Before the man was shot in the chest three times and bleed out on the ground. The next leader had his head grabbed from behind by the masked man. In an instant, the leader’s neck was snapped.

(There will be more details in the coming future for each event that is skipped.) 
 
Room by room, massacre by massacre, the onslaught would not stop until everyone that needs to be silenced, is. But the journey was already near its end. The masked man was coming up on the final floor, the executive room was last. Where all the leaders and their bitches were taking refuge. But nothing could save them from their fate. The most fortified door of the building blew to smithereens in a flash. In came the masked man, carrying his machine gun. “Please! There must be something we can do to resolve this!” One of the men cried out in desperation. But there would only be one outcome that the masked man wants. The man aimed the gun at the leader that spoke. Everyone gasped in fright. “Please don’t!” Unexpectedly the masked man lowered his gun and threw cuffs at them from his backpack. Implying to all of them to cuff themselves.

The man then took out two masks from his backpack, and showed it to them. “I take it you would like these?” The girls’ eyes widened as they nodded their heads desperately. He moved closer to the door. “I could give it to you.” He paused for a second. “But you will never enter a place like this again. Understood?” The two nodded again, the man waited a second again. “I don’t believe you. How am I to know you won’t continue supporting places like this, and let them continue to profit off suffering. It’s probably better to let you two die to be safe than sorry.” Shock, and despair washed over their faces. They would be crying right now, but they can’t. Both sides locked at each other, one full of resolve, and the other struggling to find it. “But maybe, some people deserve a do over.” He passed the masks over and the girls swiftly put them on. Gasping for air once they had it fully on, then their cries could actually be heard. “Live better now.” The man walked away and to the next room.

He heard footsteps run for the door. They tried the door handle after removing the chain but the door handle was locked in place. Then the people began slamming into the door, but it would be to no avail. More choking can be heard as more bodies collapsed to the ground and the banging on the door became weaker and weaker until it all stopped. Then the masked man heard a door open from the inside and two pairs of light footsteps could be heard. This time, the man shut off the machine and moved it out of the way of the opening to see inside. Red mist could be seen everywhere inside along the lifeless bodies on the ground. But in front of him now were two girls clinging for life. Their hands grabbing their necks in desperation.

The man then took out a spray bottle and began to spray part of the opening left in the door shut. The spray had some type of foam before quickly hardening like steel. Then he sprayed the door handles shut and the other door’s glass screen too. Then he lifted the device into the small opening that was left in the door. He placed some type of object into the machine and soon a red mist began to fill the room. Soon the room was almost full of it. Then began the coughing from the people inside, and soon the choking on their own breaths.

More gunshots and screams followed until it was all done. 
 
Then the masked man left the lunch hall, with far fewer lives within it than it used to have. The man then made his way upstairs to the second floor. There were two rooms, both barricaded. The lounge, and the first work room with computer’s all around the desks. The masked man walked to the work room first, he immediately broke the glass that was a part of the door, and peered his head in. For the first time he spoke. “For any ladies within this room, this is your boarding call to live another day, or choke on your own distrust. Take it or leave it.” The man’s voice sounded somewhat despairing yet emotionless.The masked man waited and got no response. “Alright then.” The man took out a small device and turned it on. An ominous noise loudly roared through the building.

The guy laying on the ground looked at the masked man and saw his eyes full of rage now. He tried to resist the masked man from grabbing him, but the masked man returned it with several hard blows to the head. The masked man then pulled the guy up and slammed his face into the ground, again and again. The guy’s face broke into cuts and blood as his face broke with each crush. This only made the wailing from the others grow louder. After what felt like a long minute went by, the masked man threw the man onto a nearby table and took out a karambit knife. He began slashing and stabbing at the man’s helpless body. Then the masked man centered the knife over the man’s chest. The guy’s brutalized face only read defeat and hopelessness. The masked man sighed, and sank the knife into the man’s chest. The man’s mouth slowly went agape as his life drained from his eyes. The dead silence after was only broken from the crying. Then the masked man continued his campaign to each other's table.

Then a man with an NTR blurred face. Quietly crawled out from under the table far from the masked man. He then tip-toed over to the fire extinguisher that was on the ground. At that time it looked like the masked man was frozen. The table he was looking under only had the faces of horrified and tearful ladies. Like the man was deeply thinking to himself. Quietly, the man picked up the fire extinguisher and slowly crept his way over to the masked man. He was right behind him, winding up the fire extinguisher to slam it into his head. But suddenly it was as if the masked man knew. He quickly turned around and sunk his face into the man’s face. Saliva came flying out of the man’s mouth from the blow as he fell to the ground, the fire extinguisher went flying into the air. The masked man holstered his pistol.

They all screamed and cried in horror. Everyone was hyperventilating. Then to their surprise, the masked man got up and walked to the next table people were hiding under. He crouched down again, and looked at the horrified faces. This time 5 shots were heard. Some of the girls covered their faces and cried heavily. The masked man got up once again and reloaded his revolver, and repeated. Going to the next table, crouching down, and this time he killed everyone underneath the table. The man reloaded, and went to the next table.

The man casually walked to one corner of the room, keeping the corner of his eye out on the other side. The man then pulled out a revolver and pointed it at the only NTR faced man hiding under the table with everyone else. Their faces showed true horror. The masked man's eyes were deeply concentrated on just that man, and without a second thought he pulled the trigger. The bullet pierced through the man’s head, tearing through his skull and tissue, and it splattered against the wall and some people.

The main lobby was a bloodbath. Corpses lying all around, red streams of blood decorated the floor. Some of the corpses still kept the horror on their faces. Everyone else still alive ran for the lunch hall and barricaded themselves inside. While others ran up the stairs. The masked man approached the barricaded lunch hall. Tables blocked the door while the door handles themselves were chained shut. They were making it too easy. The man reached into his pocket and took out a small red orb. He stepped back and shucked it at the door. Once the red orb made contact with the door it bursted into flames. Melting the door down and everything around it. The tables blocking the door then collapsed to the ground. The man then slowly walked past the ashes of the doorway and stepped up on the tables to walk in. He looked around and saw everyone hiding in the corners of the room. Some hide under the tables. Once wolves that hounded the innocent, were lambs to the slaughter now.

Meanwhile in the security room, one of the three guards was horrified at what just witnessed. He was readying to run out of the room with his gun when the two other guards pointed their guns at him. Shocked, and horrified, the guard lowered his gun. Then one of the security guards tossed him handcuffs, and gestured to him to handcuff himself to the door. The man did so while one guard kept his gun trained on the man while the other watched the cameras.

*Lockdown mode activated* There was no escape from the building now. Everyone looked over at the masked man that did it from the entrance door. He looked at them with emotionless, piercing eyes, behind the two holes from his fierce mask. No one knew what he saw though. His eyes were mainly concentrated on the men that had their face blurred out with NTR in front of their face. Tension was rising as both sides stared at each other. Then the man reached into his heavy backpack and pulled out a machine gun. Everyone gasped in horror and began running for cover. ‘This is the way.’ The man began to open fire on the fleeing workers, firing short bursts at each NTR worker. Blood bursted out from their bodies as bullets pierced them.

I am the monster you created.
You ripped out all my parts.
And worst of all, for me to live, I gotta kill the part of me that saw.
That I needed you more.
 
I hope you know we had everything.
And you broke me and left these pieces.
I want you to hurt like you hurt me today and.
I want you to lose like I lose when I play what could have been.
Oh, what could have been.
 
Why don't you love who I am?
What we could have been.
 
I am your ghost, a fallen angel.
You ripped out all my parts.
I couldn't care what invention you made me.
'Cause I, I was meant to be yours.
 
I hope you know we had everything.
And you broke me and left these pieces.
I want you to hurt like you hurt me today and.
I want you to lose like I lose when I play.
 
I want you to hurt like you hurt me today and.
I want you to lose like I lose when I play.
